result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Bubolz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions if revoked.

Early termination of probation after 12 months if approved by Agent.
May be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommenced.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician the conditions of probation.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: regarding the release of firearm signed by Judge Ramirez.

Defendant Thomas J Bubolz in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties address the return of the firearm to the defendant's son.  Court grants request, signs order.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Sachs makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
9 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 18 Months
Early termination of probation after 12 months if approved by agent. 
Conditions of Probation:  May be transferred to Milwaukee County. 
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician the conditions of probation. 
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
Defendant is not to possess any firearms.
Condition Time: 30 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS -  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Sentencing hearing at 04-07-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Thomas J Bubolz in court with attorney Richard A. Sachs.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1. Court schedules sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.

Defendant Thomas J Bubolz in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Petition for appointment of counsel papers provided to the defendant.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
